description: Attested since 1954. Clipping of delicatessen, from German Delikatessen, plural of Delikatesse (“delicacy, fine food”), from French délicatesse, derived from the adjective délicat, from Latin delicatus.

entries.meaning: (informal) A shop that sells cooked or prepared food ready for serving.
examples: Delis usually offer a broader, fresher menu than fast food chains.
